content.raw:
I think this does it:

~~~
diff -r 1f1b2e8a2573 package.json
--- a/package.json	Tue Aug 29 22:20:46 2017 +0200
+++ b/package.json	Fri Sep 01 11:14:05 2017 -0700
@@ -6,7 +6,9 @@
     "type": "mercurial",
     "url": "#!/osrf/gzweb"
   },
-  "scripts": {},
+  "scripts": {
+    "test": "karma start --singleRun"
+  },
   "dependencies": {
     "websocket": "",
     "http-server": "",
~~~
content.html:
I think this does it:

@@ -6,7 +6,9 @@
     "type": "mercurial",
     "url": "#!/osrf/gzweb"
   },
-  "scripts": {},
+  "scripts": {
+    "test": "karma start --singleRun"
+  },
   "dependencies": {
     "websocket": "",
     "http-server": "",

update.description:
* wip: update to three js rev86. Fixed sprites in radialmenu, joint visuals, bounding box, transform control, ray projection, material ambient. Updated collada loader and tweaked texture loading.

* update collada loader to use normal map by default if bumptype not specified

* port submesh fixes and fix submesh loading in sdfparser

* remove unused code, fixed mobile gzmanipulator trans material

* jasmine tests for sdf parser using karma task runner
update.title: Test sdfParser

and sorry for totally forgetting to review the changes before pushing.

`color` is the expected value and the result of `sdfparser.parseColor("1 1 1 1")` is the actual value

content.raw: Currently trying to build some tests that would verify spawning from the back end, e.g. Spawning a box and verifying that it really did spawn right in the server by and subscribing on model factory topic, should I continue investing time in it ? or that is out of the scope for now.
